operations

Class OperationFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • operations.OperationFactory

  • public class OperationFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    OperationFactory class is a factory that creates instances of operations such as: equals, not equals, greater than, greater or equals, less than, less or equals. This class uses singleton pattern and factory pattern.
    Author:
    razvan

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static OperationFactory getInstance()
        Get an instance of OperationFactory by creating one if there does not exist an instance, or return the existing one.
        Returns:
        the instance of OperationFactory

      • getOperationNode

        public OperandNode getOperationNode(java.lang.String expr)
        Factory method. This method creates an OperandNode by a given string. String can be:
        • eq - equal node => new EqOperation instance
        • ne - not equal node => new NeOperation instance
        • ge - greater or equals node => new GeOperation instance
        • gt - greater than node => new GtOperation instance
        • le - less or equals node => new LeOperation instance
        • lt - less than node => new LtOperation instance
        Parameters:
        expr - an expression given as string, as described above.
        Returns:
        an OperandNode instance or null

      • checkTokens

        private boolean checkTokens(java.lang.String[] tokens)
        Check if tokens meet some conditions:
        • operators are "eq ne le lt ge gt"
        • operand is "name" or "value"
        Parameters:
        tokens - an array of tokens
        Returns:
        if the conditions are met
